definition: to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
to know the enemy and know oneself (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
a thousand cups of wine is not too much when best friends meet (idiom)/when you're with close friends, you can let your hair down
pinyin: jiu3 feng2 zhi1 ji3 qian1 bei1 shao3

definition: a true gentleman will sacrifice his life for a friend who understands him, as a woman makes herself beautiful for her sweetheart
pinyin: shi4 wei4 zhi1 ji3 zhe3 si3 , nu:3 wei4 yue4 ji3 zhe3 rong2
containing_words.word: 士为知己者死，女为悦己者容

definition: close friend in a distant land, far-flung realms as next door/close in spirit although far away
pinyin: hai3 nei4 cun2 zhi1 ji3 , tian1 ya2 ruo4 bi3 lin2
containing_words.word: 海内存知己，天涯若比邻

definition: know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: zhi1 ji3 zhi1 bi3 , bai3 zhan4 bu4 dai4

definition: knowing the enemy and yourself will get you unscathed through a hundred battles (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
pinyin: zhi1 bi3 zhi1 ji3 , bai3 zhan4 bu4 dai4

definition: to consider sb as close friend (idiom); to take into one's confidence

sentences.english: I am very grateful to them. Thinking of them as confidants .
sentences.chinese: 我非常感激他们俩，感谢他们成为我的知己。

sentences.english: Then did Big bro meet any girl out there?
sentences.chinese: 那大师兄有否在江湖上遇到什么红颜知己？

sentences.english: She was Dan's favorite model, cherished confidante and dearest friend.
sentences.chinese: 她是丹最爱的偶像，珍视的红颜知己和挚友。

sentences.english: Gold apt to look for in the world, human world bosom friend difficult to seek.
sentences.chinese: 世界上黄金易找，人间知己难寻。

sentences.english: It was unlikely that we should become confidants while Rogers was in retirement .
sentences.chinese: 在罗杰斯退职后，我们就未必能成为知己。

sentences.english: She was a very considerate person, always patient and in fact was the merchant's confidance.
sentences.chinese: 她非常体贴，总是很耐心，事实上是商人的知己。

sentences.english: Su and Wen are cousins with an age difference of twenty-two years.
sentences.chinese: 兩人为相差二十二岁之表兄弟，情真意切，知己知彼。

sentences.english: She is a very considerate person, always patient and in fact is the merchant's connfidante.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，她是商人的红颜知己。

sentences.english: Knowing oneself and each other is an important prerequisite for cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 知己知彼是合作的重要前提。

sentences.english: What kind of person will you take as good friend?
sentences.chinese: 什么样的人会让你视为知己？

sentences.english: Friend of my soul, this is terrible, dismaying: it makes one's heart sink, it withers vital energy
sentences.chinese: 我心灵的知己，这太可怕，太令人沮丧了。

sentences.english: If Tong Pak Fu had a friend like you, he wouldn't have any regrets.
sentences.chinese: 如果唐伯虎能够有你这位红颜知己，真是死而无憾呀。

sentences.english: Does the woman not need male confidant?
sentences.chinese: 难道女人就不需要蓝颜知己么？

sentences.english: She is a very considerate person, always patient and in fact is the merchant’s confidante.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，她是商人的红颜知己。

sentences.english: Missed our kind as a pass-by.
sentences.chinese: 如路人一样错过了我们的知己。

sentences.english: Confidant is just for you living.
sentences.chinese: 知己这两个字就是为你而取的。

definition: a friend capable of direct admonition
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
friendship between gentlemen, insipid as water (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])
a gentleman's friendship, insipid as water (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])
pinyin: jun1 zi3 zhi1 jiao1 dan4 ru2 shui3
